snippet: Some Republican strategists are prepared to create ads that concede the White House to Hillary Clinton and urge voters to support down-ballot candidates who would keep the party in charge of Congress....
abstract: Large number of Republican leaders and incumbents are taking steps to distance themselves from Donald Trump following week of feuds and falling poll numbers, in effort to disassociate themselves from candidate seen as damaging to party; many incumbents hope voters will view their reelection bids as completely separate from Trump's presidential race.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and ALEXANDER BURNS
byline.contributor: Giovanni Russonello and John Corrales contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Some Republican strategists are prepared to create ads that concede the White House to Hillary Clinton and urge voters to support down-ballot candidates who would keep the party in charge of Congress.

headline.main: As Donald Trump Incites Feuds, Other G.O.P. Candidates Flee His Shadow
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Candidates Aiming to Escape Trump’s Shadow
